#summary ACX Archive Format

= Introduction =

ACX is a container for ADX files. This is a common format that has been used in many non-Puyo Puyo games. 

*Values inside an ACX archive are stored in big-endian. Also, files inside the archive must be stored at an offset that is divisible by 4.*

== Header ==
0x00 - 0x03: 0000 0000
 Magic Code, 4 bytes

0x04 - 0x07   Unknown
 (4 bytes) Number of files in the ACX archive.

== File Offsets & Length (starting at 0x08) ==
This is repeated for the number of files in the archive.

0x00 - 0x03
 (4 bytes) Offset of the file in the archive.

0x04 - 0x07
 (4 bytes) Size of the file in the archive.
